# Introduction to APIs

Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) are how applications on the web communicate - they allow users to submit and retrieve data using a structured set of endpoints. 

APIs may be intended for private use, e.g.: the back end of an application, or public use: e.g.: dissemination of open data.

APIs allow websites to interact and communicate
